result.execSummary:
The defendant Esgar Leal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Spoke with Ben in Dispatch to cancel warrants.
Defendant appears by video from the Dane County Jail

10:05 a.m. Defendant appears in custody from the Dane County Jail.  Defendant makes statement regarding previous payment plan.  Court notes defendant owes a $1,570.00 on past due cases and $543.00 on 16CM274, in which a warrant is ready to be signed, on for a total of $2,113.00.  Court orders defendant to pay $50/month, by the end of each month, commencing in June.  If defendant is unable to pay $50/month, he may perform community service at a rate of $7.50/hour or a combination of a monetary payment and community service.  If defendant fails to make payment/community service or contact the Clerk of Court's Office with a reasonable explanation as to why he cannot pay or do community service in lieu of payment, the Court will convert the balance to a jail term at $60/day.  Court quashes all warrants.  Defendant provides his current address. Court adjourned 10:11 a.m.
(warrant to GLSO on 3/22/18)

10:36 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - matter is resolved.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2015CM229, Count 1 in 2016CM83, Count 1 in 2016CM171 and count 1 in 2016CM274 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Roeth recites sentence credit:  1 day on 15CM229; 1 day on 16CM83; 2 days on 16CM171 and 26 days on 16CM274.  No objection by DA.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged in 2015CM229, on count 1 as charged in 2016CM83, on count 1 as charged in 2016CM171 and count 1 as charged in 2016CM274.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 in 2016CM171 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

2015CM229

-10 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM83

-10 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM171

-20 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CM274

-Time served.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of :  1 day on 2015CM229, 1 day on 2016CM83, 2 days on 2016CM171.

Sentence is to commence immediately.  Any cash bonds on file are to be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 10:49 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Court adjourned at 2:23 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

11:40 a.m  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - not resolved, but working on a resolution and requests more time.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on Novmeber 15, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.

Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.

2:13 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant qualifies for PD representation and will be representing him.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 3, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m.
